intro: Nonea sordida, commonly known as the dirty nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its small, dark purple flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its toxic properties, it is generally avoided for consumption or cultivation.
